snippet: A daring break from a secure prison by the notorious cartel figure has enhanced his status as an outlaw folk hero in his home state and beyond.
abstract: Joaquin Guzman Loera, Mexican drug kingpin known as El Chapo who recently escaped from high-security prison, is popular folk hero, especially in his home state of Sinaloa; many people cheered his escape and say he and other drug traffickers have done more than government has to help ordinary citizens.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and AZAM AHMED
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Culiacán, and Azam Ahmed from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: A daring break from a secure prison by the notorious cartel figure has enhanced his status as an outlaw folk hero in his home state and beyond.

headline.main: Public Enemy? At Home in Mexico, ‘El Chapo’ Is Folk Hero No. 1
headline.print_headline: ‘El Chapo,’ Public Enemy, Is Also Folk Hero No. 1
